greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of Skolem sequences of order n.
comment: Number of permutations of the multiset {1,1,2,2,...,n,n} such that the distance between the elements i equals i for every i=1,2,...,n.
Number of super perfect rhythmic tilings of [0,2n-1] with pairs. See A285698 and A285527 for the definition and tilings of triples and quadruples. - _Tony Reix_, Apr 25 2017
reference: CRC Handbook of Combinatorial Designs, 1996, p. 460.
link: Ali Assarpour, Amotz Bar-Noy, Ou Liuo, Counting the Number of Langford Skolem Pairings, arXiv:1507.00315 [cs.DM], 2015.
S. Burrill and L. Yen, Constructing Skolem sequences via generating trees, arXiv preprint arXiv:1301.6424 [math.CO], 2013.
formula: For n>1, a(n)=A059106(n)*2 because A059106 ignores reflected solutions. - _Martin Fuller_, Mar 08 2007
mathematica: (* Program not suitable to compute a large number of terms. *)
a[n_] := 1/2^(2n) Sum[Product[x[i], {i, 1, 2n}] Product[Sum[x[k] x[k+i], {k, 1, 2n-i}], {i, 1, n}], iter[n] // Evaluate];
Table[Print[a[n]]; a[n], {n, 1, 10}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 29 2018, from formula in Assarpour et al. *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
ext: More terms (via A059106) from _Martin Fuller_, Mar 08 2007
Extended using results from the Assarpour et al. (2015) paper by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 22 2016 at the suggestion of _William Rex Marshall_
